title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.6 - Serial number of uniform traffic ticket
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.6 - Serial number of uniform traffic ticket

State Regulations
(a) A serial number shall be printed in the
upper right-hand corner of each part of the uniform traffic ticket, parallel to
the long side of the ticket. (b) Such number shall be printed in red or black on part I in numerals at least
3/16 of an inch in height. On the remaining parts, such number may be black or
a color resulting from the print on part I and the carbon
interleaves. (c) Packets shall be
numbered in consecutive serial number order by the printer thereof. (d) Serial numbers on supplies of packets
procured separately need not follow a continuous sequence. Example:If the first purchase of packets by an enforcement
agency is serially numbered from 1 to 1,000, it is not required that the next
supply of packets procured by such agency bear serial numbers starting with
1,001. However, no serial number may duplicate the number of another ticket
issued by the same agency during the previous year. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
91.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
